website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty ratchet tie-down set with an impressive breaking strength of 5,208 lb.
pros: Set comes with four 1.6” x 8’ ratchet tie-downs and four 1.7” x 16’ soft-loop tie-downs
Double-diamond stitching on webbing provides additional strength
cons: High price than some other choices, but they have an impressively high breaking strength

customer_reviews.title: Says right on the box "Made in PRC" Peoples Republic China...
customer_reviews.text: Work pretty good. Bent one of the tabs in the ratcheting mechanism first time using them. That was probably my bad. Got the black set, and they haven't faded on me yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for updating tie down gear in my toy hauler!
customer_reviews.text: Having just bought a brand new motorcycle, i wanted to see what my options were to update the tie down gear I have since we are fulltimers and have a toy hauler which moves place to place. I was impressed with the specs of this kit and once recieved it (quickly I might add) I looked the kit over and felt I made the right decision. I wont actually put them to the test till the day after xmas but am very impresed with what I see.
customer_reviews.author: vtxkid

customer_reviews.title: Worked excellently to strap a 1000 lb. motorcycle to the trailer
customer_reviews.text: Transported a large motorcycle on a trailer 1200 miles each way (99% interstate highway miles). Outbound trip I used straps from Lowe's rated at 1666 lbs load/5000 lbs break strength. One snapped on the way down; fortunately not one of the main load bearing straps but rather a stability strap. Needed something better so these were rated at 5200lbs break, and it was a kit. The ratchets were better than the Lowes. Made the return trip with no issues and the straps were in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Special Here
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned, used and worn out a lot of ratchet straps in my days. Hauling building materials, ATVs, boats, camping, you name it, i’ve used a ratchet strap with it. These Rhino USA straps are nothing special. Sure they come in a fancy box, with fancy packaging and a reuasable bag, but at the end of the day these are average straps at best. Also note, these are NOT USA made. Don’t let the deceptive name fool you. Mine were made in PRC....people’s republic of China. Save $30 and buy a decent set from Home Depot, Menards, Harbor Freight, etc. they will accomplish the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 100 miles only
customer_reviews.text: Two trips less than 100 miles and it’s already failing, I wouldn’t recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Issam N. Mansour

customer_reviews.title: Misleading - Chinese made, Not USA
customer_reviews.text: Rhino USA straps are made in P.R.C. (China), not in the USA. Also, as someone else noted, release buckle does not operate well. I returned my set asap.
customer_reviews.author: Watchful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was great, packing was great. I tied tying my bike down today, to leave on a trip this Saturday, one ratchet strap will not work? I paid big money for these straps thinking i was getting quality, No you get made in China junk. I may as well of gone to harbor freight Don't waste your money BS
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Webb

customer_reviews.title: Securing new UTV to flatbed trailer
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness of the straps for securing my new side-by-side to the trailer. Good grip and super strength. Just what I was looking for, and the customer service and American company pride are welcome!
customer_reviews.author: 4wrod

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: These tiedowns failed after the first 3 uses. The release tabs on the side are now bending outwards so they won't release anymore. Bought these to support a small USA business, but regret it now. Called for support in November and now its February and I haven't received a call back. Spend a little more and get something of better quality. Poor product, poor service.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: Nice Package, good looking product however the first one I assembled and tried, bound up and I had a terrible time getting it to release. I don’t think I can trust this product to haul my motorcycles let alone be able to get them to release when I need to. Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Allen Laribee

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, could use better fabric
customer_reviews.text: I have used the cam-lock style tie downs from Rhino to tie down our plan for a couple of years with no problems or abnormal wear and tear. These tie downs are less then stellar. The good: - The clip on both hooks is awesome - Sturdy mechanism - It is easy to manipulate the ratchet between locked, ratcheting, and released The bad: after only three uses the tie downs are beginning to fray along the edges. I hoped to get a lot longer of a life out of these but it looks like they are likely only going to last a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus C Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as back-up tie down straps for moving heavy cruiser-style motorcycles in a trailer. The quality of these straps is excellent, the handles and cinch mechanism were smoother and without the intermittent problems I experiences with the primary/heavier straps. The color is bright (I purchased green) and the material is strong enough for moving 1300 pounds of motorcycle 1400+ miles over rough roads including driving on the moon at times in Illinois and Wisconsin. I would purchase these again and would recommend them to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: John J Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I use a majority of different types of straps for both personal and business. And I gotta tell you, I am truly impressed by these straps, definitely heavy-duty, and the spring clips are extremely reliable and useful when strapping things down in awkward, hard-to-reach places. Without a doubt, I will definitely add Rhino USA Ratchet Straps to my list of necessities for future needs.
customer_reviews.author: LOUIS SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Looks very promising out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Just got this set to anchor down my 1,000 lb. 3-wheel motorcycle to a trailer. Though I haven't actually been able to use them yet, the set looks like it's really well made, high quality components. In addition to all the pieces promised in the Amazon ad, they threw in some velcro straps to secure free ends od the tie down straps so they won't go flapping in the breeze.
customer_reviews.author: IPLsux

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice. The problem I have with the company is they hide behind the title “Rhino USA” but they are manufactured in CHINA!!!! That’s wrong! You don’t point out on your website how your product is “ designed and engineered” in the USA and then farm out the work. You know how important USA is or you wouldn’t have pointed it out. Shame shame shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A REAL Set of Tie-Down Straps
customer_reviews.text: Super-strong, high QUALITY ratchet straps. These are NOT the straps you get from a big-box store's automotive department. These are thick, wide, and well-built. I use these to tie down a RZR 1000 to my trailer, and I go with confidence. Material is soft, pliable, and strong. Hooks are good, tempered steel with wide openings. Ratcheting mechanism is smooth, robust, and seem to be well-built. The only con I have, and the only reason I gave four stars instead of five, is they are designed in the USA, but made in CHINA. Rhino USA would be wise to move production to the USA, and support our people.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wilhoit

customer_reviews.title: Thew BEST!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I hadn't bought these sooner. Very well made with strong material. I used them to transport my motorcycle and will also be using them to tie down camping gear on my Jeep. I can crank down nice and tight without fear of the bike shifting around or the straps loosening or breaking. And they come with a nice carry bag too. IMPORTANT USER NOTE: Pay close attention to the ratchet mechanism when tightening the straps to be sure the strap feeds into the crank straight and even. Otherwise it can jam up and even damage the strap webbing.
customer_reviews.author: hawkrider

customer_reviews.title: Great for Motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: I used these to tie down my 925 lb Harley Ultra. They held the bike flawlessly and didn't leave any scratches on the chrome. I only have two minor complaints. The plastic ends on the safety clips keep slipping off. But, they slip right back on. Also, the orange coloring in the product description and on the packaging does not reflect the actual coloring of the straps. They looked like they'd match my Harley accessories. But, the actual coloring of these straps is more of a bright neon or fluorescent orange. In hindsight, I should've ordered the black.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Im a 64 year old woman who has never used these before. I took them to Home Depot and asked a guy to help me and he wanted to know where I got them as he was SO impressed with this product. He said, “They are MUCH better than the ones we sell here.” He said he was going to ‘order some’ himself from Rhino. I have been very pleased with this product and would HIGHLY recommend. The Rhino company has been awesome and I guess I should have just called them with my stupid question, but was pleased to see my salesman’s reaction to this product as he thought they were might fine. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: jwb, RN

customer_reviews.title: Good so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use the straps, and they look like they are well built. My only issue is that they are made in China. I will update my review after using them. Update: I used them for the first time yesterday to tie down my 1500 lb. Side by side. They worked great and seem to be a high quality product. Only time will tell. They operate smoothly and the padded ratchet grips are an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to worry about quality with these
customer_reviews.text: These straps are relatively inexpensive travel insurance against damage for any motorcycle. Yes, they're a bit pricier than many other ratchet straps but once you see/use the Rhinos you'll never have to worry about tie-down issues again. The spring loaded hook lock tabs are why I bought these. With the hook lock tabs if the strap should ever come loose for any reason the hook "can not" unhook from whatever it's attached to because of the locking tabs.
customer_reviews.author: What!

customer_reviews.title: They work, but they're sticky to release
customer_reviews.text: These would be great if they didn't get sticky trying to loosen them. It's just the center hub being hard to turn that is the problem. I've used them 8 times now and they continue to stick, but I didn't want them flinging grease on my bike so I haven't tried lubing them. The locking bar can shift a bit sideways making it even harder to release the pressure. I had to grab a pair of pliers once to pull the locking bar back into place one time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ratchet strap set for securing motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered another set of popular straps prior to needing to secure a motorcycle for a 3+ hour trip in my van only to find out they weren't the best for my application in the van since they didn't have hooks or anything and only came with 2. I ordered these with 8 AM delivery and they saved the day. Included straps for the bars were perfect. Secured 2 straps to the bars and 2 straps to the rear frame to hooks on either side of the van. Kept it solid as could be in the center of the van. Great quality and packaging. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MicahT

customer_reviews.title: Working good.
customer_reviews.text: They looks good and are doing the job. The ratchet mechanism is a little sticky and sometime is hard to get ratcheting or release. I have used bigger straps on car hauler trailers that operate better. The plastic covering on the hook I connect to my trailer started coming off after the 2nd use. The one connected to the soft tie is still ok. I do like the included bag and soft ties. I can't say anything else about th durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: ken ziesemer

customer_reviews.title: Very good ratchet straps, well worth the money if you want a quality ratchet strap
customer_reviews.text: I frequently use ratchet straps, cold weather and odd or heavy loads can be a challenge. These ratchet straps are much better quality than ones I have picked up at large home or farm supply stores. Don't get me wrong, some of those straps at the stores I am referring to have served well, but I am saying that the Rhino straps are superior in how they are manufactured. I expect them to last a very long time with confident use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good straps
customer_reviews.text: We're using these with our new camper van (to secure storage bins in the back of the van to metal tie-downs installed in the van floor. We're buckling and un-buckling them several times a day to access the stuff in the bins. I almost always have to fuss with the buckle to get the straps loose, which is frustrating, but find it very easy to strap things down again. Very strong. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: P. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Rhino straps
customer_reviews.text: I use these to strap my Honda Pioneer 1000-5 on my trailer. They appear to be very quality straps. I am glad I chose Rhino straps. I put the sticker on the side of my Pioneer, but it isn't a quality sticker and the sticky side separated from the image instantly. Made me kinda sad cause it's a really cool looking sticker. These ARE ratcheting straps.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Not very Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these straps because they claimed to be heavy duty and made in the USA. The quality did seem very good however they were not heavy duty compared to other straps in the market. The webbing was on the thin side and the metal that the ratchet was made of was also too thin for me to consider them heavy duty. I would think that if the size of the metal and the thickness of the webbing was greater being they are made in the USA they would sell more of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tie Downs!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set of tie downs based on Amazon and other online reviews and I am very pleased with the quality and ease of use. The tie downs are very well made and are perfect for my primary use for them to tie down an ATV on a trailer. The tie downs provide soft loops as well as the capability to use hooks if needed. So far, the tie downs have held up well and more than adequately secured my ATV. I highly recommend these tie downs.
customer_reviews.author: RonT

customer_reviews.title: i mean it works sometimes
customer_reviews.text: loosens on every use no matter how flat or nice the road is. Hard to loosen the strap even when its not attached to anything. wish i had not been on vacation so long. no i can't return these very disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Haahtag_butt

customer_reviews.title: Wrecked! Read the review
customer_reviews.text: I like to really test a product before leaving a review. These straps are heavy duty, wide straps,great quality and STRONG. I strapped down one of my motorcycles in the back of my truck,I was driving down the interstate and traffic came to an abrupt stop. Another full size truck rear ended me,he never even hit his brakes so he was running at least 75mph. The bike didn't even move...like I said ,strong straps!
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA was the first thing that caught my eye.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love about these straps. Made in the USA was the first thing that caught my eye. Just one of the straps is stronger than three straps combined from the set I "WAS" using. After having a bike tip over coming back from Sturgis this year, I really appreciate the mousetraps on all the hooks. I'll probably buy another set in the next couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lowriderob

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Super product! Sturdy, double-lock ratchets. Perfect length for motor bike or scooter. Extra, short straps included to securely wrap around handlebars. The receiver ratchet is good & short so no worries about the hardware scratching your paint. And the best part is the hooks have a securing tab so they offer peace of mind for straps coming undone during transport. All that and a tidy carrying bag with Velcro straps to keep your straps nice & tidy. This pack is perfect for securing 2 bikes better than any product I’ve used. Just buy these and don’t look back.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Leslie Andrews

customer_reviews.title: SO SHORT
customer_reviews.text: Work well now. The test will be to see how they hold up. EDIT: They haven't held up. They are way to short for use on any of our trailers. They tend to loosen after use, super safe when they are holding your Polaris onto a trailer. (Hopefully you can read the sarcasm there)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent straps! I bought these to temporarily secure a truck camper for the ride home. I was surprised at the quality of both the straps and the ratcheting mechanisms. Handles are large and rubber coated, gearing is positive and smooth, straps are well made and sewed. If you are used to off the rack straps like I am, you are going to love using these. I will certainly by more products from Rhino.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Bad ratchets and not big enough for UTV
customer_reviews.text: I have now broken 2 of the 4 ratchets strapping down my honda talon. The ratchets will bend and flex allowing the release mechanisms to bind up and it takes some help from a screw driver to get them unstuck. 1 of them also has continually come lose while towing and made me think I was crazy for like 5 trips. Over all I'm pretty disappointed the ratchets didnt hold up because the quality of everything else is phenomenal. I think they would hold a motor cycle but a utv was to much.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STRAPS.
customer_reviews.text: I Normally kill a pair of good straps every season. So far I am on season 2 with NO signs of wear, or fraying, I tow a lot, thousands of miles a year, Laconia, Daytona, Sturgis are a few I do every year. I use a pair in my enclosed trailer and on my local use open trailer. In all weather, Rain, Snow, exstream heat, and freezing ice storms.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Jianshe

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair the first set that I ordered was to small and a handle broke on one of them. I was hauling a 2019 Polaris Ranger,so I wrote back to the company and just like they promised they replaced it for FREE! They sent me a larger size one and I liked it so much I ordered the larger set and love it. Also love the sticker put my first one on my tailgate of my Ranger lost the second one but sure would like a second one if I can so I can put it on the other side of my tailgate
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Spalding

customer_reviews.title: Great quality straps for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I've used these only a couple times to haul my SxS. The quality is great and love the spring clips. I recently had a competitor strap and after 1 trip returned them due to the spring clip bent immediately. My only feedback would be I wish they were 2" straps as I'd feel more comfortable hauling my toys around with a bit wider strap, but so far so good. Thanks Rhino for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Miller Family

customer_reviews.title: Well made and priced at a premium.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for hauling my UTV on my trailer. They do work very well and are easy to use. The product appears to be of the quality to last a long time, but only time will tell. These come at a premium price compared to their competitors, but the price difference appears to be worth it. I will update my review if they do not last.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Catastrophic failure
customer_reviews.text: The ratcheting mechanism is great, ergonomics are excellent. The long strap with hook is dangerous. Sheared off clean upon first use. Not due to load, actual product failure. Luckily, I was loading the strap and not driving down the road when that happened. I was thrilled with rhino recovery straps as they've saved me many times offroad. Purchased these ratchets thinking I would receive a product of similar quality. Sadly mistaken

customer_reviews.title: Really nice set of ratchet tie downs
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of jumping the gun here on reviewing these. I can tell you that they are heavy duty looking and come packaged very well. I expect them to hold my Harley and place and don't say a problem with them doing that. I can look at a ratchet style tie down and know if it is good or cheap. I believe these are worth the money I've spent on them.
customer_reviews.author: bsedmonds

customer_reviews.title: Great straps!
customer_reviews.text: Great straps! I use them to tie down dirt bikes from a 90, all they way up to a 650. They’ve worked great on a trailer or in the back of the truck. Ratchets work great and haven’t had any issues with them getting stuck or metal bending. I initially ordered the Amazons choice straps that are blue and those bent first time I used them. I’ll gladly get another set when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B.

customer_reviews.title: Good but..
customer_reviews.text: Straps are OK but I think they get a lot more hype than is deserved. The ratchet mechanism on mine bound up a few times and it does not seem as smooth as they should be for all the hype. That being said they do seem to be well made and would expect them to last quite a while. Just a little disappointed in the ratchet mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Ratchets are a real pain
customer_reviews.text: I'm not saying they are terrible, but the ratchet mechanism does NOT work well for me and sadly I gave a set as a gift. For the money, you should shop around. I don't really know the high end, but I have seen some really crappy ratchet straps over the years. The other problem is the spool portion is just too small.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Superior
customer_reviews.text: By far the best ratchet straps I've ever seen and definitely owned. I had a set I bought at Walmart last me a long time and when they finally wore out I looked at Walmart but they didn't have the same ones so I bought the nicest ones they had and they were crap. So I went on here and found the nicest ones and they are truly superior.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Straps are way too long for a motorcycle.
customer_reviews.text: Straps are ENTIRELY too long? Very hard to tie down a motorcycle
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Very nice looking and came in a nice carry pouch but these straps are not very well made. I’ve been using a set for over a year and the locking mechanism on the ratchet strap comes out of place every time I use them. It’s a pain to have to release tension. Surely I’m not the only one that’s had this issue. I’ve emailed the manufacturer and never received a response. I’d look elsewhere. I tossed mine today and ordered a new set from another manufacturer. I didn’t even want these as backups, I ordered two new sets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, Good S**T!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was Tired of buying the junk Big Box Stores sell. I've broke many of those straps, so I decided to look around for a better Quality strap with a clip. These straps are HIGH quality and a complete package as well. This is what the big box stores should be selling!!!! Wish I found these long ago!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for our ATV
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade the strength and break resistance for strapping/securing our SxS to the trailer -- just for extra peace of mind when towing the machine. Seemingly great product - nicely constructed; appears durable. Time will tell on long towing trips. For now, I'm extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for in a ratchet strap set.
customer_reviews.text: My brother who recently purchased the Rhino ratchet strap set highly recommended these after thoroughly researching online for a high quality set. So I purchased them and could not be anymore pleased. They are everything I was looking for in a ratchet strap set. They hold down my 1,000 lb Harley Road Glide to my trailer with no problem. They are easy to use, of high quality and very durable. They even come with 4 velcro strips to secure the excess strap. I'm sure I will get many years of use out of these.
customer_reviews.author: scuji

customer_reviews.title: Used Several Times with great success
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy straps that are easy to use. The clip on the hooks makes them quite secure. Black keep them looking OK - hides the grease from whatever you are tying down. Have used them to tie down motorcycles to a trailer at least 6 times and they are working as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: CC from Florida

customer_reviews.title: RHINO RINHO RINHO
customer_reviews.text: THIS TIE DOWN STRAP KIT SEEMS VERY STRONG AND WELL BUILT IT IS THE CLOSEST THING TO PERFECT BOUGHT THESE TO TRAILER MY HONDA ST1300 AND CBR1100XX BLACKBIRD I DON'T THINK I WILL HAVE ANY WORRIES, THESE ARE THE BEST I HAVE EVER OWNED VERY CONFIDENT THAT THEY WILL NOT FAIL
customer_reviews.author: POOCH

customer_reviews.title: Great straps
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit to tow your motorcycle. You will be able to tie down the front and back with no worries. Ive done multiple track days and they have held up just fine. They are sturdy, made of good material and look good. I get compliments from other riders about them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Superem

customer_reviews.title: Great straps and a nice bag
customer_reviews.text: These straps are perfect for my UTV. Nice bag to toss into car, and quick and fast to get a good tie down onto utv, with nice Velcro strips to tie up the straps. My buddies and I have all bought these straps for our utv's. Nice price for 4x strong straps with Hooks that cant fall off.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy, just doesn’t include storage bag
customer_reviews.text: These straps are great quality and heavy duty. The stitching even is strong and very well done. The ratcheting mechanism seems very smooth and held everything down nicely on the short 10 minute drive. Will update more as I take it cross country here soon. I only docked one star because they picture it with a storage bag but it does not come with one. I don’t have to have one but it is nice to have that to keep everything together and they do show that it comes with some sort of bag I thought but it did not oh well. The meat of the product is still fantastic so I can’t complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gerguis

customer_reviews.title: Rhino out lasts others
customer_reviews.text: I have used Rhino straps in the past and when I needed more I looked for Rhino brand. This set of straps is more heavy duty than the first set. The first set by the way is still working for me everyday. I have purchased others but these seem to be the best of the lot.
customer_reviews.author: Pudge

customer_reviews.title: Awesome straps exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly the ratchet, feels very sturdy and heavy ratchets and releases smoothly. The strap portion are nice and well made and do not loosen up much after securing your load. For the hooks I liked how they have a retaining clip to help prevent you strap from coming out prematurely. Overall awesome product held my bike in place over the duration of a couple days going over some descents bumps and pot holes without having to retighten the straps. I would highly reccomend for anyone that is looking for straps to use for their bike.
customer_reviews.author: chad feller

customer_reviews.title: Hard to release
customer_reviews.text: Nice package and storage bag. Bought for tying down motorcycle in back of truck. The straps are hard to release, and they are easy to jam. Carry a pry bar with you to release the straps.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Strong, heavy duty, great straps
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to transport our motorcycles over 1000 miles when we moved. Great product, held tight. Made of heavy duty nylon, easy release ratchets and the closure on the hook adds extra security that it will not slip off during transportation. We even ordered extra sets to give to our sons for Xmas for transporting their bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Miller

customer_reviews.title: Straps with loops are heavy duty and secure to tie down the Heritage.
customer_reviews.text: First time to trailer my bike. Moving 2000 miles. Loaded the bike in advance using my new RHINO straps. Once I got the hang of using a ratchet it was easy. Glad I got the kit with the soft loops. This gives the confidence that the bike is secure as the straps are heavy duty and not Slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Really nice tie downs
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use these to transport my M/C up to get tires put on (I pushed it a little too far and had cords showing, so I couldn't ride it up there). Anyway, these are really nice tie downs and worked really well. I was very confident that they would do the job of securing my bike to the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Lye

customer_reviews.title: I'd have given a 3.5 but rounded up to 4 because they aren't all that expensive
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are a quality product for the money. I bought two sets; I really liked the additional Soft Loop Tie Downs Strap. After a very limited amount of usage, 3 of the mechanisms regularly stick and are a pain in the ass to use. WD40 fixes it temporarily.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, not USA
customer_reviews.text: excellent straps. easy to use. seem durable. lifetime warranty. decent price. minus one star for the misleading Rhino USA name as these are made in China. Only "designed and engineered in USA". I probably would have considered other straps if I would have known
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them so far
customer_reviews.text: Used them for first time today to secure snowmobile and 150cc scooter on my trailer. They seem very beefy without being bulky and were very smooth. They come with nice bag and velcro straps to secure extra strap from just flapping in the breeze
customer_reviews.author: notquiteajedi

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving Name
customer_reviews.text: They do seem like a strong sturdy strap but I feel like I was deceived in the name. They proudly call them rhino USA. In fact they are made in China. I for one will never buy anything else from Rino USA
customer_reviews.author: Michael Powers

customer_reviews.title: A well thought out product/solution.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good quality straps. I was hesitant to spend the money when you can get less expensive alternatives. But these won’t come unhooked if the tension relaxes a little (as it often does when towing a trailered ATV or SXS at highway speeds). The kit includes everything you need and even includes Velcro type wraps to neatly organize and secure the straps for storage when not in use. That is a really needed and thoughtful touch! I’m glad I spent the extra coin!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Crouse

customer_reviews.title: s hooks w/clips
customer_reviews.text: MOST OF THE TIME WHEN STRAPPING CARGO DOWN YOUR ALONE, WITH THESE S HOOKS W/CLIPS ITS GREAT. YOU JUST HOOK THEM IN TO YOUR HOLDS AND THEY STAY SO YOU CAN BE ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE AND NOT WORRY ABOUT THEM UNCLIPPING. MAKE THE JOB ALLOT EASIER. WHEN I SAW THEM ONLINE I BOUGHT TWO SETS.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Badass
customer_reviews.text: Bad ass Straps. Our last ratchets were bouncing right on off of our trailer every time we would drive. But these babies don’t move at all. They just are made of quality you can feel. Our stuff is no longer bouncing around and they are just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany stedman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several products from Rhino in the past. Great packaging etc.. However, very disappointed with my recent purchase on these straps. The very first time I used the straps the black plastic protection on the hooks chipped away on the every single strap. At this point Im sure I will be needing to replace them after the rust sets in on the hooks. Lesson learned on this purchase for sure..
customer_reviews.author: Mike from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: It’s not MADE IN USA
customer_reviews.text: ONLY 3 STARS It’s not MADE IN USA PLEASE!!!!!!! RHINO USA OK PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: ELCIO ALMEIDA

customer_reviews.title: Great for trailering Harleys
customer_reviews.text: Used these to tie down Harley-Davidson Street Glides. Loaded our 3 bikes for a trip to Cleveland Ohio without a problem. No slips or and problems. Bikes all stayed upright with no issues. Bikes are all over 800 pounds each. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: They are exactly doing what they supposed  to do.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good... I have purchased that pack for my trail bikes. So far they are working very well. They feel sturdy and of good construction. I like the color, you can't miss them on the side or on the ground
customer_reviews.author: eric mathieu

customer_reviews.title: OK for the cost
customer_reviews.text: These tie downs are not as durable as I would have hoped for. After 8 uses tying down an 1,800 pound UTV (4 loads and 4 unloads), the protective coating on the hooks had chipped away and there was significant wear (abrasion) on the straps. The ratchet portion of the these straps seems well designed and constructed. The Velcro storage loops are a great add. These loops allowed me to keep the straps from getting tangled during storage and secure the excess strap during transport. While I like these tie downs, I don't think that these are the right straps for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: America!
customer_reviews.text: I know they are just ratchet straps but by golly they are solidly crafted and just done right. If you miss Made In America stuff that is worth the price and not highly suspect import materials and workmanship then here you are! Totally worth every penny and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Super Strong
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these Rhinos for my side by side. They are a beast and made extremely strong. My only complaint which is minor is that after the first as only use of the strap is the protective coating each hook is dipped in cracked and fell off after I cinched down the straps. Minor but worth sharing. They are very expensive and would think they would hold up a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: These straps are the real deal! Sturdy, easy to use, and did I mention sturdy??? What else can you say about them...they're exactly as described. I used these on a 700lb mower. It didn't move an inch. The straps didn't loosen at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Great customer.service and excellent looking product!
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time and packaged up very well. The item looks very durable and I clean. There are NO frayed stitches and extra strap material hanging off. I havent had a chance to use them yet but they look to be a well made top quality product!.the warranty is phenomenal. And I will most likely buy more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great straps with extras and bag
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and I love the bag. Lots of extras included. Ties my side by side down perfectly. First time setup took a few minutes but no biggy. Would buy again in a heart beat and highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Crossed

customer_reviews.title: Quality, tough straps
customer_reviews.text: These straps are great, they feel and perform as you would expect a high quality tough as nails strap to perform. They are comfortable to use, and with the loops you dont have to risk scratching your cargo. I feel much more confident with these straps securing my load than the cheap ones I had been using.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Far superior in quality and function to what I was using. an adapt to any application. I use on my Can Am Maverick sport to secure to trailer. Prior generic tie-downs loosened in transport and actually a hook has disengaged on the ones I was using. These are expensive for sure but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J. Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Great Producr
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in order to securely transport my wife’s Vespa scooter. These work very well are easy to install and insured that the scooter wasn’t going to tip over while in the back of a pick up truck
customer_reviews.author: Shomare

customer_reviews.title: Not Used Yet
customer_reviews.text: We can't give a review yet because we have not tried the straps out. My husband did said "SWEET" when he opened up the package which tells me he liked them. I will update my review once we get the change to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: UNEXPECTED QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: OMG, just received a set of 4 Rhino ratchet straps and soft tie Rhino straps. I had high expectations based on the research and reviews I read, but I'm beyond happy with the quality of this product. I cant tell you how many times I've ordered products based on marketing photos and manipulated reviews, only to receive something less than expected. I've just become a Rhino customer forever.
customer_reviews.author: TX TM

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice sturdy easy to use set. It doesnt kink and is heavy duty. For those of you that are complaining that its made in China know that the quality is of American standards. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as motorcycle tie downs. You could secure a car with these these things. Heavy duty. Top quality. The best tie down system I have ever seen or used and I’ve been doing this a very long time. Pricey, but worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: These straps DO THE JOB RIGHT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used the Rino Straps on Monday to bring home my new to me, a 2009 Harley Davidson Heritage Soft Tail motorcycle home. The bike was solid, and did not move around at all. It rode perfect, and didn’t move on the102 mike ride home. You could tell by trying to move the bike test before I left the seller’s house. I definitely recommend these straps for anyone who wants to do the job the right way, and hold your items down tightly. I give these straps, a solid 10+.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TIE DOWNS MADE TO SECURE
customer_reviews.text: I use these tie downs to secure my dirt bike. Since I use a trailer and ride on Louisiana roads the tie downs need to be heavy duty. There are cheaper tie downs, but I can't imagine why anyone would risk damaging their bike to save $10-$15. I didn't rate these tie downs for durability because I haven't had them that long, but they look like they are made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Straps that I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use the straps for the first time this past weekend and I honestly can say these are the best made straps that I've ever used. The quality of the strap is top notch and ease of use is phenomenal. I would recommend or buy these straps again in heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Stress Involved
customer_reviews.text: Used these straps for my HD Dyna in the back of my toy hauler for a 600 mile round trip. I stopped after 100 miles and checked them out, and they were just as tight as when I left. I checked on the way home from the trip and same deal. Very nice, high quality straps. I will never buy another strap from anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: ripped the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Used it to travel from NJ to Fl on my Goldwing. Got half way there and checked the strap and it was already separating, not cut but coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: S Belm

customer_reviews.title: Great strap for Utv’s and Atv’s
customer_reviews.text: Love the straps. Did the job better than I expected. Wish the straps were a little more padded where I would wrap around something to hook it back to itself. Definitely have recommended the straps to my family member who has been looking for a strap for his side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Not good value for the quality
customer_reviews.text: Not that great. Strap can get entangled if not careful & precise. Also, often times when strapped down hard, it freezes and very hard to get it to unlock
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Just because its the most popular does not mean it is the best
customer_reviews.text: The straps are good quality, but I had a problem where there release would get jammed badly. It seems like they put more effort into making the ratchets seem ergonomic but the parts that really matter are not up to snuff i.e. the latch that releases the strap. Not satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Garone

customer_reviews.title: Really good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these straps 1 time and they worked fine. Quality of the product appears to be really good so expect them to last quite a while for many trips to the Ranch.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had the chance to use these straps yet, but my initial inspection of the product is that they are perfect for securing my motorcycle. Solid stitching and ratchet quality
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great strap
customer_reviews.text: Yes you can buy cheaper straps, but that is what you get. These straps are very well made and and worth every penny. Easy to use and strong. I have no worries about these breaking while going down the highway.
customer_reviews.author: shannon foote

customer_reviews.title: So so product.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes. I was hoping the larger construction would made these easier to operate. However, the release catches and can be difficult to let go. Plus the handles don’t lock in well.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Compton

customer_reviews.title: Tie down straps
customer_reviews.text: Moving vehicles and needed strong tie downs. These worked well. Held up to the strain. My only suggestion is to order longer straps. I have a 28ft trailer and should have ordered longer ones.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: What a quality Product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: RHINO ratchet straps are of the highest quality available, they are strong and reliable, the ratchet is the best I have ever used, overall I highly recommend this product for your use. Would also make a good present for anyone that would have a need for straps. John
customer_reviews.author: John T.

product_meta.title: RHINO USA Ratchet Straps Heavy Duty Tie Down Set, 5,208 Break Strength - (4) Heavy Duty 1.6" x 8' Cargo Tiedowns with Padded Handles & Coated Chromoly S Hooks + (4) Soft Loop Tie Downs Strap (GREEN)
feature_bullets: ▶ SUPPORT A SMALL FAMILY CO. - Buy From a Father/Son Business in California & Receive a Lifetime Warranty!
▶ SUPERIOR BUILD QUALITY - Coated Steel Rachet, Chromoly S-Hooks and Indestructible PolyBlend Webbing
▶ SECURE PEACE OF MIND - Knowing the Car, Truck, Motorcycle, ATV, UTV you Love is Secure when Travelling
▶ RELIABLE PERFORMANCE - Heavy Duty Incredible 5,208lb Break Strength! You Get What You Pay For!
▶ GUARANTEED 5-STAR EXPERIENCE - If you aren't 100% Satisfied for any Reason, We'll Refund Your Money

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,586 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
